item.title: bima
item.description: How can we package unikernels in the OCI image format? To address this challenge, we created bima, a tool specifically designed for this purpose.

item.title: FlexOS
item.description: FlexOS is a unikernel-based OS allowing users to easily specialize the safety and isolation strategy of an OS at compilation/deployment time, instead of design time.

item.title: Genezio
item.description: genezio is a platform for developers to write and host a serverless application. You are writing your backend logic in classes and design your frontend using your preferred programming language.

item.title: Hermit
item.description: Hermit is Rust-based, lightweight unikernel. It targets a scalable and predictable runtime for high-performance and cloud computing. The ownership model of Rust guarantees memory/thread-safety and enables us to eliminate many classes of bugs at compile-time.

item.title: HermiTux
item.description: HermiTux is a unikernel binary-compatible with Linux: it can run native Linux executables. It supports multiple compiled (C, C++, Fortran) and interpreted (Python, LUA) languages.

item.title: Loupe
item.description: Loupe is a tool designed to help collect and analyze the system call usage of an application. The tool can tell you what system calls need to be implemented in a custom OS to run the analyzed application, and visualize these numbers in a variety of plots.

item.title: MirageOS
item.description: MirageOS is a library operating system that constructs unikernels for secure, high-performance network applications across a variety of cloud computing and mobile platforms.

item.title: OSv
item.description: OSv is an open-source unikernel designed to run a single unmodified Linux application securely as microVM on top of a hypervisor.

item.title: Toro Kernel
item.description: Toro is a simple kernel that provides a dedicated API to develop microservices. We propose two kinds of sockets to build microservices: blocking and non-blocking.
